subject: New Character needed?
msgSnippet: I ve been looking at the great tutorials available on the Web and the QS Manual, and I ve noticed something. The letterforms are not ambiguous without a
messageBody:
I've been looking at the great tutorials available on the Web and
the QS Manual, and I've noticed something.
   The letterforms are not ambiguous without a baseline.
   It's easy enough to read a line of text, small letters establish
the bottom and top of the baseline and make the rest readable. But
when writing a single character or very short string, there will
sometimes be problems.
   One possible fix is to change the Colon character (or make a new
one) that places dots at the baseline and the top of the small
characters, establishing the relative 'altitude' of the letter(s) in
question.
   Another possibility is using this in place of a Namer Dot, though
the conflict of purposes may cause problems.
   As I understand it, the block-structure of Unicode assignments
means that our current proposals have a few characters free anyway.

   How about it, Fontmakers?

   <Disclaimer: Though I am the original author of QSJ Block, that was
a one-off project that never got completed. I do not consider myself a
fontmaker.>

   terI
